{"id":1320253270,"question_id":3484,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"6 months, 4 weeks","timestamp":1720925394,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1320253270/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Lexicographically Smallest String After a Swap","memory":"N/A","code":"/*\nGiven a string s containing only digits, return the \nlexicographically smallest string\n that can be obtained after swapping adjacent digits in s with the same parity at most once.\n\nDigits have the same parity if both are odd or both are even. For example, 5 and 9, as well as 2 and 4, have the same parity, while 6 and 9 do not.\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    string getSmallestString(string s) {\n        int sz = s.length();\n        int ans = stoi(s);\n        string  res_s = s;\n        for(int i=0; i<sz-1; i++) {\n            if((s[i]+s[i+1])/2 == 0 ) {\n                string new_s = s;\n                new_s[i] = s[i+1];\n                new_s[i+1] = s[i];\n                int new_ans = stoi(new_s);\n                if( new_ans < ans ) {\n                     ans =  new_ans;\n                     res_s = new_s;\n                };\n            }\n        }\n        return res_s;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"lexicographically-smallest-string-after-a-swap","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
